name: Lotus
watering: Water when the top inch of soil feels dry. Adjust watering frequency based on season and environment
soil: Use well-draining potting mix suitable for plant type
temperature: Maintain temperatures between 15-34°C for most plants
pruning: Remove dead or yellowing leaves. Prune to maintain shape and encourage growth
sunlight: Provide appropriate light conditions - most plants prefer bright indirect light
fertilizer: Feed with balanced fertilizer during active growing season. Reduce feeding in winter
pests: Regularly inspect for common pests. Treat infestations early with appropriate methods
seasonalTips: Reduce watering in winter. Increase humidity in dry conditions. Rotate plant for even growth

name: Tulsi
watering: Water when soil feels dry to touch. Keep soil moderately moist
soil: Well-draining soil with good organic content
pruning: Regularly pinch off flower buds to encourage leaf growth
pests: Watch for aphids and caterpillars. Use neem oil spray
seasonalTips: Bring indoors during extreme winter. Prune regularly in growing season

name: Aloe Vera
watering: Water deeply but infrequently. Allow soil to dry completely between watering
pruning: Remove dried outer leaves. Harvest mature leaves from base
sunlight: Bright indirect light, can tolerate some direct sun
fertilizer: Diluted balanced fertilizer once in spring
pests: Mealybugs and scale insects. Treat with alcohol swabs
seasonalTips: Reduce watering significantly in winter. Protect from cold drafts

name: Money Plant
watering: Water when top soil feels dry. Avoid overwatering
pruning: Trim long vines to encourage bushier growth
sunlight: Bright indirect light, tolerates low light
fertilizer: Balanced liquid fertilizer monthly during growing season
pests: Spider mites and mealybugs. Mist leaves regularly
seasonalTips: Grows well in monsoon. Reduce feeding in winter

name: Rose
watering: Deep watering at base, avoid wetting leaves
pruning: Prune in late winter. Remove dead wood and shape plant
fertilizer: Rose-specific fertilizer every 4-6 weeks during growing season
pests: Aphids, black spot, powdery mildew. Use fungicide when needed
seasonalTips: Heavy pruning in winter. Mulch in summer to retain moisture

name: Jasmine
watering: Keep soil consistently moist but not waterlogged
pruning: Prune after flowering to maintain shape
pests: Whiteflies and spider mites. Use insecticidal soap
seasonalTips: Flowers profusely in summer. Protect from strong winds

name: Snake Plant
watering: Very drought tolerant. Water every 2-6 weeks
pruning: Remove damaged leaves at soil level
fertilizer: Mild cactus fertilizer during growing season
pests: Very pest resistant. Occasionally mealybugs
seasonalTips: Nearly indestructible. Perfect for beginners and low-light conditions

name: Mango Tree
watering: Deep watering weekly during dry periods
pruning: Prune after harvest to maintain height and shape
fertilizer: Balanced fertilizer during growing season, high potassium during fruiting
pests: Fruit flies, anthracnose. Use appropriate pesticides
seasonalTips: Flowers in spring, fruits in summer. Protect young trees from frost

name: Spider Plant
watering: Keep soil moderately moist. Reduce in winter
pruning: Remove brown tips. Trim plantlets to propagate
fertilizer: Balanced liquid fertilizer monthly in growing season
pests: Spider mites, scale. Wipe leaves with damp cloth
seasonalTips: Produces plantlets in spring/summer. Great air purifier

name: Marigold
watering: Water when soil feels dry. Avoid overhead watering
pruning: Deadhead spent flowers to encourage more blooms
fertilizer: Balanced fertilizer at planting, then monthly
pests: Aphids, spider mites. Generally pest-resistant
seasonalTips: Plant in spring for summer/autumn flowers. Tolerates heat well

name: Coconut Palm
watering: Regular deep watering, especially when young
pruning: Remove dead fronds only
pests: Rhinoceros beetle, red palm weevil. Monitor regularly
seasonalTips: Thrives in coastal areas. Protect from strong winds

name: Peace Lily
watering: Keep soil consistently moist. Wilts when thirsty
pruning: Remove spent flowers and yellow leaves
pests: Spider mites, mealybugs. Mist leaves regularly
seasonalTips: Flowers more with brighter light. Excellent air purifier

name: Neem Tree
watering: Drought tolerant once established. Water young trees regularly
pruning: Prune to shape and remove dead branches
fertilizer: Generally doesn't need fertilizer. Compost occasionally
pests: Very pest resistant due to natural pesticides
seasonalTips: Fast growing in hot climates. Medicinal properties

name: Rubber Plant
watering: Water when top inch of soil is dry
pruning: Prune to control height and encourage bushiness
fertilizer: Balanced liquid fertilizer monthly in growing season
pests: Spider mites, scale. Wipe leaves to keep clean
seasonalTips: Rotate regularly for even growth. Wipe leaves for better photosynthesis

name: Hibiscus
watering: Keep soil consistently moist but well-drained
pruning: Prune in early spring to encourage blooming
pests: Aphids, whiteflies, Japanese beetles
seasonalTips: Blooms throughout warm months. Bring indoors in cold climates

name: Areca Palm
watering: Keep soil evenly moist but not soggy
pruning: Remove brown fronds at base
pests: Spider mites, mealybugs. Mist regularly
seasonalTips: Humidity lover. Great for adding tropical feel indoors

name: Cucumber
watering: Consistent moisture, especially during fruiting
pruning: Train vines on trellis. Remove damaged leaves
fertilizer: Balanced fertilizer when planting, side-dress when flowering
pests: Cucumber beetles, powdery mildew. Use row covers
seasonalTips: Plant after last frost. Harvest regularly to encourage production

name: ZZ Plant
watering: Very drought tolerant. Water every 2-3 weeks
pruning: Remove yellow stems at base
pests: Very pest resistant. Occasionally scale insects
seasonalTips: Nearly indestructible. Perfect for offices and low-light areas

name: Tomato
watering: Deep watering at base, keep leaves dry
pruning: Remove suckers for larger fruits. Stake plants
pests: Hornworms, aphids, blight. Rotate crops annually
seasonalTips: Plant after last frost. Mulch to conserve moisture and prevent disease

name: Bamboo
watering: Regular watering, especially during dry spells
pruning: Thin out old canes. Control spread with barriers
pests: Generally pest resistant. Occasionally bamboo mites
seasonalTips: Some varieties invasive - use root barriers. Fast growing

name: Chili Pepper
watering: Moderate watering, allow soil to dry slightly between
pruning: Pinch early flowers to encourage bushier growth
fertilizer: Balanced fertilizer, higher phosphorus for fruiting
pests: Aphids, pepper maggots. Companion plant with basil
seasonalTips: Loves heat. Harvest regularly to encourage more fruit production

name: Cactus
watering: Water thoroughly then let soil dry completely
pruning: Generally not needed. Remove dead sections
pests: Mealybugs, scale. Treat with alcohol swabs
seasonalTips: Reduce watering significantly in winter. Most grow slowly

name: Banana Plant
watering: Keep soil consistently moist
pruning: Remove old leaves. Keep main stem and one sucker
pests: Aphids, banana weevil. Remove affected plants
seasonalTips: Loves humidity. Fruit takes 9-12 months to develop

name: Lavender
watering: Drought tolerant once established. Avoid overwatering
pruning: Prune after flowering to maintain shape
fertilizer: Light feeding in spring. Avoid high nitrogen
pests: Generally pest resistant. Good for repelling insects
seasonalTips: Excellent for dry gardens. Harvest flowers for drying in morning

name: Orchid
watering: Water once weekly, allow to drain completely
soil: Special orchid bark mix, not soil
pruning: Cut flower spike after blooming. Remove dead roots
fertilizer: Orchid fertilizer weekly weakly during growth
pests: Mealybugs, scale. Improve air circulation
seasonalTips: Most bloom once yearly. Requires specific care but rewarding

name: Mint
watering: Keep soil consistently moist
pruning: Pinch tips to encourage bushiness. Harvest regularly
pests: Generally pest resistant. Sometimes aphids
seasonalTips: Very invasive - grow in containers. Dies back in winter, returns in spring

name: Fiddle Leaf Fig
watering: Water when top inch of soil is dry
pruning: Prune to control height and shape. Wear gloves - sap irritant
fertilizer: Balanced liquid fertilizer monthly in growing season
pests: Spider mites, mealybugs. Wipe leaves regularly
seasonalTips: Sensitive to changes. Rotate for even growth. Popular but fussy

name: Sunflower
watering: Regular watering, especially during dry periods
pruning: Generally not needed. Deadhead if not saving seeds
fertilizer: Light feeding. Too much fertilizer can weaken stems
pests: Birds, squirrels. Use netting if needed
seasonalTips: Plant in spring after last frost. Fast growing annual

name: Basil
watering: Keep soil moist but well-drained
pruning: Pinch flower buds to encourage leaf production
pests: Aphids, Japanese beetles. Companion plant with tomatoes
seasonalTips: Loves heat. Harvest regularly from top to encourage bushiness

name: Pothos
watering: Water when soil feels dry. Very forgiving
pruning: Trim long vines to encourage fullness
pests: Mealybugs, scale. Generally pest resistant
seasonalTips: One of easiest houseplants. Great for beginners and low light

name: Lemon Tree
watering: Regular deep watering. Allow soil to dry slightly between
pruning: Prune to shape and remove crossing branches
pests: Scale, aphids, citrus leaf miner. Monitor regularly
seasonalTips: Protect from frost. Can be grown in containers in cold climates

name: Fern
watering: Keep soil consistently moist but not soggy
pruning: Remove brown fronds at base
fertilizer: Balanced liquid fertilizer monthly during growth
pests: Spider mites, scale. Loves humidity
seasonalTips: Mist regularly or use pebble tray for humidity. Avoid direct sun

name: Coriander
watering: Keep soil consistently moist
pruning: Harvest outer leaves regularly. Pinch flower buds to delay bolting
pests: Aphids, leaf miners. Generally few pests
seasonalTips: Bolts in heat. Plant in cool seasons. Succession plant every 2-3 weeks

name: Succulents
watering: Water thoroughly then let soil dry completely
pruning: Remove dead leaves. Behead leggy plants to propagate
pests: Mealybugs, scale. Avoid overwatering
seasonalTips: Great for containers. Many varieties available. Drought tolerant

name: Bougainvillea
watering: Drought tolerant once established. Water deeply but infrequently
pruning: Prune after flowering cycle. Wear gloves - thorns
pests: Generally pest resistant. Occasionally aphids
seasonalTips: Loves heat and sun. Blooms more when slightly root-bound

name: Chinese Evergreen
watering: Water when top inch of soil is dry
pruning: Remove yellow leaves. Can cut back if leggy
pests: Spider mites, mealybugs. Wipe leaves occasionally
seasonalTips: Very tolerant of low light. Great beginner plant

name: Papaya Tree
watering: Regular deep watering, especially when fruiting
pruning: Generally not needed. Remove dead leaves
pests: Fruit flies, papaya ringspot virus. Choose resistant varieties
seasonalTips: Fast growing. Fruit within year. Both male and female plants needed for fruit

name: Dracaena
watering: Water when top soil feels dry. Sensitive to fluoride
pruning: Cut back tall canes to encourage branching
pests: Spider mites, scale. Use distilled water if leaf tips brown
seasonalTips: Many varieties. Great air purifier. Toxic to pets

name: Brinjal
watering: Regular watering, consistent moisture
pruning: Pinch early flowers to encourage bushier growth
fertilizer: Balanced fertilizer, higher phosphorus for fruiting
pests: Flea beetles, fruit borers. Use row covers when young
seasonalTips: Loves heat. Harvest when fruits are shiny and firm

name: Monstera
watering: Water when top inch of soil is dry
pruning: Prune to control size. Can remove aerial roots
fertilizer: Balanced liquid fertilizer monthly during growth
pests: Spider mites, scale. Wipe leaves regularly
seasonalTips: Famous split leaves develop with age and good light. Provide support

name: Okra
watering: Regular deep watering
pruning: Generally not needed. Harvest pods regularly
fertilizer: Balanced fertilizer at planting, side-dress when flowering
pests: Aphids, stink bugs. Generally few serious pests
seasonalTips: Loves heat. Harvest pods when young and tender for best flavor

name: Calathea
watering: Keep soil consistently moist but not soggy. Use distilled water
pruning: Remove damaged leaves at base
fertilizer: Balanced liquid fertilizer monthly during growth
pests: Spider mites, mealybugs. Requires high humidity
seasonalTips: Leaves move throughout day. Sensitive to chemicals in water

name: Guava Tree
watering: Regular watering, especially during dry spells and fruiting
pruning: Prune after harvest to maintain shape and size
pests: Fruit flies, guava moth. Bag fruits for protection
seasonalTips: Fast growing. Fruit within 2-4 years. Several harvests per year in tropics

name: Croton
watering: Keep soil consistently moist but not waterlogged
pruning: Prune to maintain shape and encourage bushiness
sunlight: Bright direct light for best leaf color
fertilizer: Balanced liquid fertilizer monthly during growing season
pests: Spider mites, mealybugs. Mist leaves to prevent pests
seasonalTips: Color intensifies with bright light. Sensitive to temperature changes

name: Curry Leaf
watering: Water when top soil feels dry. Drought tolerant once established
pruning: Regular harvesting encourages new growth
fertilizer: Compost or balanced fertilizer monthly during growing season
pests: Scale insects, psyllids. Use neem oil spray
seasonalTips: Leaves may drop in cold weather. Protect from frost

name: Dieffenbachia
watering: Water when top inch of soil is dry
pruning: Remove lower leaves as they yellow. Cut back if too tall
pests: Spider mites, aphids. Wipe leaves regularly
seasonalTips: Toxic if ingested. Wear gloves when pruning - sap can irritate

name: Dahlia
watering: Regular deep watering. Keep foliage dry
pruning: Deadhead regularly. Pinch tips for bushier plants
pests: Slugs, earwigs, spider mites
seasonalTips: Dig up tubers in cold climates for winter storage

name: Elephant Ear
watering: Keep soil consistently moist
pruning: Remove damaged leaves. Cut back in winter
pests: Spider mites, caterpillars
seasonalTips: Loves humidity. Can be grown in water gardens

name: English Ivy
watering: Water when soil feels dry. Avoid overwatering
pruning: Trim to control growth. Can be invasive outdoors
fertilizer: Balanced liquid fertilizer monthly during growth
pests: Spider mites, aphids. Loves cool conditions
seasonalTips: Good air purifier. Can be trained on trellises

name: Ficus
watering: Water when top soil is dry. Consistent moisture
pruning: Prune to shape in spring. Wear gloves - sap irritant
fertilizer: Balanced liquid fertilizer monthly during growing season
pests: Spider mites, scale, mealybugs
seasonalTips: Sensitive to movement and changes in light. May drop leaves when stressed

name: Gardenia
watering: Keep soil consistently moist but well-drained
pruning: Prune after flowering to maintain shape
sunlight: Bright indirect light to partial sun
pests: Whiteflies, mealybugs, spider mites
seasonalTips: Famous for fragrant flowers. Requires high humidity

name: Geranium
watering: Water when soil feels dry. Avoid overwatering
pruning: Deadhead regularly. Pinch tips for bushiness
pests: Whiteflies, caterpillars. Generally pest resistant
seasonalTips: Can be brought indoors in winter. Many colorful varieties

name: Grape Vine
watering: Deep watering weekly during dry periods
pruning: Heavy pruning in dormancy. Train on trellis
pests: Japanese beetles, birds, powdery mildew
seasonalTips: Requires winter chill for good fruiting. Harvest in late summer

name: Hens and Chicks
watering: Drought tolerant. Water when soil is dry
pruning: Remove dead leaves. Separate chicks to propagate
pests: Generally pest free. Occasionally aphids
seasonalTips: Excellent for rock gardens. Very cold hardy

name: Hostas
watering: Keep soil consistently moist
pruning: Remove flower stalks if desired. Cut back in fall
pests: Slugs, snails, deer. Use slug bait if needed
seasonalTips: Excellent shade plant. Many leaf colors and sizes available

name: Ixora
watering: Keep soil moist but well-drained
pruning: Prune after flowering to maintain shape
pests: Aphids, scale, spider mites
seasonalTips: Blooms year-round in warm climates. Sensitive to cold

name: Jade Plant
watering: Water when soil is completely dry
pruning: Prune to shape. Can bonsai
pests: Mealybugs, scale. Avoid overwatering
seasonalTips: Considered lucky plant. Very long-lived with proper care

name: Kalanchoe
watering: Water when soil feels dry
pruning: Deadhead spent flowers. Pinch back after blooming
pests: Mealybugs, scale. Generally pest resistant
seasonalTips: Blooms in winter. Short-day plant - needs long nights to rebloom

name: Lady Palm
watering: Water when top soil feels dry
pruning: Remove brown fronds at base
pests: Spider mites, scale. Very pest resistant
seasonalTips: Very adaptable and hardy. Excellent for low light conditions

name: Lantana
watering: Drought tolerant once established
pruning: Deadhead to encourage blooming. Can cut back hard
pests: Generally pest resistant. Attracts butterflies
seasonalTips: Blooms continuously in warm weather. Can be invasive in some areas

name: Lithops
watering: Very specific watering needs by season
pruning: Not needed. Do not water during splitting
fertilizer: Very light feeding during growth period
pests: Mealybugs, root rot from overwatering
seasonalTips: Living stones. Water only during growth periods, not when splitting

name: Magnolia
watering: Regular deep watering, especially when young
pruning: Prune after flowering if needed
pests: Scale, magnolia borers. Generally pest resistant
seasonalTips: Famous fragrant flowers. Some varieties evergreen, some deciduous

name: Maidenhair Fern
watering: Keep soil consistently moist but not soggy
pruning: Remove dead fronds at base
fertilizer: Balanced liquid fertilizer monthly during growth
pests: Spider mites, scale. Requires high humidity
seasonalTips: Very delicate. Mist daily or use humidity tray. Sensitive to chemicals

name: Mandevilla
watering: Keep soil moist but well-drained
pruning: Prune to control size. Can be trained on trellis
pests: Spider mites, mealybugs, whiteflies
seasonalTips: Tropical vine with showy flowers. Bring indoors in cold climates

name: Maple Tree
watering: Regular deep watering, especially when young
pruning: Prune in late summer to avoid bleeding sap
fertilizer: Balanced fertilizer in spring if needed
pests: Aphids, scale, borers. Generally healthy
seasonalTips: Famous for fall color. Japanese maples popular for landscaping

name: Maranta
watering: Keep soil consistently moist but not soggy
pruning: Remove damaged leaves. Can cut back if leggy
fertilizer: Balanced liquid fertilizer monthly during growth
pests: Spider mites, mealybugs. Requires humidity
seasonalTips: Prayer plant - leaves fold up at night. Sensitive to fluoride in water

name: Mimosa
watering: Drought tolerant once established
pruning: Prune to shape when young
pests: Webworms, mimosa wilt. Choose resistant varieties
seasonalTips: Fast growing. Pink puffball flowers. Can be invasive in some areas

name: Moon Cactus
watering: Water when soil is completely dry
pruning: Not needed. May need to regraft if top dies
pests: Mealybugs, scale. Avoid overwatering
seasonalTips: Grafted cactus. Colorful top lacks chlorophyll, needs the green base

name: Morning Glory
watering: Regular watering, especially during dry spells
pruning: Can be invasive. Control spread as needed
fertilizer: Light feeding. Too much fertilizer reduces flowers
pests: Japanese beetles, leaf miners
seasonalTips: Fast growing annual vine. Flowers open in morning, close by afternoon

name: Moss Rose
watering: Drought tolerant. Water when soil is dry
pruning: Not needed. Self-cleaning
pests: Generally pest free
seasonalTips: Excellent for hot, dry areas. Flowers close on cloudy days

name: Nasturtium
watering: Water when soil feels dry
pruning: Not needed. Deadhead to prevent self-seeding
pests: Aphids, cabbage worms. Edible flowers and leaves
seasonalTips: Fast growing annual. All parts edible with peppery flavor

name: Norfolk Island Pine
watering: Water when top soil feels dry
pruning: Generally not needed. Don't cut main leader
pests: Spider mites, scale. Mist regularly
seasonalTips: Popular Christmas plant. Slow growing. Keep away from heat vents

name: Oleander
watering: Drought tolerant once established
pruning: Prune after flowering to shape
pests: Aphids, scale, caterpillars
seasonalTips: All parts highly toxic. Beautiful but handle with care

name: Onion
watering: Consistent moisture, especially during bulb formation
pruning: Not needed. Harvest when tops fall over
pests: Onion maggots, thrips. Rotate crops
seasonalTips: Plant in spring for summer harvest. Day length affects bulbing

name: Pansy
watering: Keep soil moist but well-drained
pruning: Deadhead regularly to prolong blooming
pests: Aphids, slugs. Generally few pests
seasonalTips: Cool weather annual. Plant in fall for winter/spring color in mild climates

name: Peacock Plant
watering: Keep soil consistently moist but not soggy
pruning: Remove damaged leaves at base
fertilizer: Balanced liquid fertilizer monthly during growth
pests: Spider mites, mealybugs. Requires high humidity
seasonalTips: Stunning leaf patterns. Fold leaves at night. Sensitive to water quality

name: Peony
watering: Regular deep watering
pruning: Deadhead after blooming. Cut back in fall
pests: Ants (harmless), botrytis blight
seasonalTips: Long-lived perennial. May take 2-3 years to establish and bloom

name: Pepperomia
watering: Water when soil feels dry. Sensitive to overwatering
pruning: Pinch tips to encourage bushiness
fertilizer: Balanced liquid fertilizer monthly during growth
pests: Mealybugs, spider mites. Generally pest resistant
seasonalTips: Many varieties with different leaf shapes and colors. Compact growth

name: Petunia
watering: Water when soil feels dry
pruning: Deadhead regularly. Cut back if leggy
pests: Aphids, budworms. Generally easy care
seasonalTips: Continuous bloomer all season. Many colors and forms available

name: Philodendron
watering: Water when top inch of soil is dry
pruning: Prune to control size. Can be trained on support
fertilizer: Balanced liquid fertilizer monthly during growth
pests: Spider mites, mealybugs, scale
seasonalTips: Very adaptable. Many varieties from vining to self-heading types

name: Pineapple
watering: Water when soil feels dry. Drought tolerant
pruning: Remove dead leaves. Harvest fruit when ripe
pests: Mealybugs, scale. Generally few pests
seasonalTips: Takes 18-24 months to fruit. Can be grown from crown of store-bought fruit

name: Plumeria
watering: Water when soil is dry. Reduce in winter
pruning: Prune to shape after flowering
pests: Spider mites, scale, mealybugs
seasonalTips: Famous for fragrant flowers used in leis. Goes dormant in winter

name: Poinsettia
watering: Water when soil feels dry. Avoid overwatering
pruning: Prune back in spring. Wear gloves - sap irritant
pests: Whiteflies, mealybugs. Generally pest free
seasonalTips: Short-day plant for colorful bracts. Difficult to rebloom indoors

name: Pumpkin
watering: Regular deep watering
pruning: Not needed. Train vines if space limited
fertilizer: Balanced fertilizer, higher phosphorus for fruiting
pests: Squash bugs, vine borers, powdery mildew
seasonalTips: Needs plenty of space. Harvest before first frost for storage

name: Radish
watering: Consistent moisture for quick growth
pruning: Not needed. Thin seedlings for proper spacing
fertilizer: Light feeding. Too much nitrogen causes leafy tops
pests: Flea beetles, root maggots. Use row covers
seasonalTips: Fast growing - ready in 3-4 weeks. Plant in cool weather
